10.1016/j.chb.2022.107479.title: Moral Expressions, Sources, and Frames: Examining COVID-19 Vaccination Posts by Facebook Public Pages
10.1016/j.chb.2022.107479.author: Zhang, Weiyu and Wang, Rong and Liu, Haodong
10.1016/j.chb.2022.107479.paperMotivationText: Paper investigates which moral values are more prevalent in the COVID-19 vaccination context and are likely to trigger reactions from individuals.
10.1016/j.chb.2022.107479.paperContributionText: Paper makes suggestions on understanding the limits and the structure of social media ecosystems, utilizing moral values in social media discourses, and addressing COVID-19 vaccine related controversies
10.1016/j.chb.2022.107479.paperResultsText: Study shows that moral expression is prevalent in the COVID-19 vaccination posts, surpassing nonmoral content
